word: We should keep our minds upon the love, the mercy, and the graciousness of our God. . . . Thus joy will be brought into our experience, for we shall see by studying the Word of God that we are not left to our weakness, to our doubts, and that there is no occasion for sighing under discouragement. Talk faith, act faith. . . . I have not always dwelt on the good things of God as I should have done; but I do not make it a practice to look on the dark side. . . .
